intro: Sykesia calycina, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sykesia calycina prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ornamental value has led to the development of numerous cultivars with varying flower colors and leaf patterns.
